name: isomorphic-json-fetch
description: A small wrapper around (isomorphic) unfetch geared specifically for handling JSON app-wide
author: Xunnamius

scripts.build: npm run clean && NODE_ENV=production tsc --project tsconfig.types.json && NODE_ENV=production webpack -p && NODE_ENV=production babel src --extensions .ts --out-dir dist/modules && { echo -n '"undefined"!=typeof window&&(window.global=window);'; cat dist/umd.js; } > dist/umd.js-tmp && mv -f dist/umd.js-tmp dist/umd.js
scripts.build-docs: rm -rf docs && typedoc --plugin typedoc-plugin-markdown --out docs --readme none --mode library src/index.ts && find docs -name '*.md' -exec sed -i -e 's/`__namedParameters`: //g' {} + && find docs -name '*.md' -exec sed -i -e 's/__namedParameters/\(destructured\)/g' {} + && sed -i -e 1,4d docs/README.md
scripts.check-types: rm -f npm.pipe; touch npm.pipe; command -v unbuffer >/dev/null; X=$?; [ $X -eq 0 ] && unbuffer tsc >> npm.pipe; Y=$?; [ $Y -eq 0 ] && echo >> npm.pipe; unbuffer eslint . >> npm.pipe; Z=$?; [ $X -ne 0 ] && tsc >> npm.pipe && eslint . >> npm.pipe; cat npm.pipe | less -R -FX; rm npm.pipe; [ $X -ne 0 ] && [ $? -eq 0 ] || [ $Y -eq 0 ] && [ $Z -eq 0 ]
scripts.publishGuard: npm run check-types && npm run test && npm run build && npm run check-build
